meanings.definition: A person or group that sets the pace or standards for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: The pacesetters in the race motivated everyone to run faster.
meanings.sent2: The team of pacesetters led the way for others to follow in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The pacesetters at the front of the line made the others feel determined to keep up.
meanings.sent4: Being a pacesetter in innovation is like being a guiding light for the industry.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pacesetters crossing the finish line first stayed in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: The act of setting the pace or standards for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: Her consistent pacesetters in the project ensured everyone stayed on track.
meanings.sent2: The importance of pacesetters in a marathon is to keep the runners motivated.
meanings.sent3: The pacesetters in the dance class made sure everyone kept up with the rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Setting new trends in fashion requires being a pacesetter in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The pacesetters in the meeting made sure the agenda was followed efficiently.
